98.heading: Flagston, Chip.
98.title: "Gee, Dad, I Always Wanted to be Just Like You"

99.heading: Flagston, Chip.
99.title: "Good Ol' Chip, He's a Born Husband"
99.author: Dik Browne
99.appears_in: p. 120 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Chip asks Lois why Dad's money is both of theirs, but her money is hers alone; Hi overhears.

100.heading: Flagston, Chip.
100.title: "How Do You Feel About "*!!+@!??"
100.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
100.appears_in: p. 108 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Hi has a talk with Chip about not using certain words, and developing a more refined vocabulary.

101.heading: Flagston, Chip.
101.title: "I Can't Believe How Messy Chip Leaves His Bed"
101.author: Chance Browne.

102.heading: Flagston, Chip.
102.title: "I Decided to Go Around and Around for a Change"
102.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip is mowing the lawn in a circular pattern.

103.heading: Flagston, Chip.
103.title: "I Just Lined Up a Golf Game"
103.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip has fixed the lawnmower, but now Hi has other plans and Chip is stuck doing the yard.

104.heading: Flagston, Chip.
104.title: "Now He's Going to Wake Up the Whole Neighborhood"
104.author: Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip finally makes good on his promise to mow the lawn, but it's after dark and he's wearing a light on his forehead.

105.heading: Flagston, Chip.
105.title: "Ski Boots, a Spring Mattress, an Old TV Set, a Car Battery..."
105.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip's excited about all the neat stuff he's seen while snorkeling.

106.heading: Flagston, Chip.

107.heading: Flagston, Chip.

107.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi tells Chip how his father used to make him rake leaves.

108.heading: Flagston, Chip.
108.title: "That's Not My Job!"
108.author: Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip mows the lawn but leaves a patch where Trixie left her ball. Hi wants to know why he doesn't just move the ball.

109.heading: Flagston, Chip.

109.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: The song begins, We'll stick together, and Chip heard it in a TV commercial for denture adhesive. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Dentures"

notes: Summary: Hi has a talk with Chip about not using certain words, and developing a more refined vocabulary.

126.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
126.title: "I Can't Use the Weather as an Excuse Not to Mow the Lawn This Morning"
126.author: Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi's mowing the lawn in the rain, so he can play golf later.

127.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
127.title: "I Just Lined Up a Golf Game"
127.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip has fixed the lawnmower, but now Hi has other plans and Chip is stuck doing the yard.

128.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
128.title: "I Packed Up My Golf Clubs, My Bowling Shoes, the Booze in My Desk, and Quit!"
128.author: Dik Browne
128.appears_in: reprinted on p. 221 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: At a bar with Hi, Thirsty talks about leaving his job.

129.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
129.title: "I Wanted Her To See What Our Lawn Could Look Like If She Really Worked At It!"
129.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Irma Thurston is joining Hi and Thirsty on the golf course today.

130.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
130.title: "My Prayer Book"
130.author: Dik Browne
130.appears_in: reprinted on p. 152 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Thirsty has found his ball in the woods, and Hi offers to toss him what he needs from his golf bag.

131.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
131.title: "That's The Way It Goes"
131.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
131.appears_in: p. 122 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Thirsty made money in the stock market, but Hi can't afford to buy stock because he's buying diapers, toys, games, kids' clothes, radios, stereos, and saving for college.

132.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
132.title: "They're Great for Climbing Trees, Dad"
132.author: Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi can't find his golf shoes, and Ditto has them.

133.heading: Flagston, Hiram.
133.title: "We Better Play Again Tomorrow"
133.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi and Thirsty see a snowflake on the golf course.

134.heading: Flagston, Lois.
134.title: "Good Ol' Chip, He's a Born Husband"
134.author: Dik Browne
134.appears_in: p. 120 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Chip asks Lois why Dad's money is both of theirs, but her money is hers alone; Hi overhears.

135.heading: Flagston, Lois.
135.title: "How Come the Years go by so Fast, and February Takes Forever?"
135.author: Dik Browne
135.appears_in: reprinted on p. 166 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Lois and Hi talk about how time flies, but Hi is standing with his golf clubs looking out at the snow.

136.heading: Flagston, Lois.
136.title: "I Always Thought That Was What Moms Did Best"
136.author: Chance Browne
136.appears_in: p. 123 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Lois tells Ditto that she's not a mind reader.

137.heading: Flagston, Lois.
137.title: "Sorry, I Had a Slurp in My Ear"
137.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie didn't hear Lois call because Dawg was licking her.

138.heading: Flagston, Lois.
138.title: "The Telephone Number of a Boy Who'll Cut Your Lawn for $4"
138.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Lois is selling a house, and offers a bonus to the buyer.

139.heading: Flagston, Lois.
139.title: "Way to Go, Mom!"
139.author: Dik Browne
139.appears_in: p. 27 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Lois get's Hi's paycheck to put in the bank, and also keeps her own.

140.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
140.title: "Child-Safe Jigsaw Puzzle"
140.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie wants to know how she's supposed to eat such big pieces.
Key word: Choking. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Safety"

141.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
141.title: "I Never Mind Being Bugged by a Butterfly"
141.author: Chance Brown.
notes: Summary: Trixie makes distinctions among kinds of bugs.

142.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
142.title: "If They're No Good for Laughs, What Good Are They?"
142.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Mom tells the twins not to laugh at Trixie's hiccups.

143.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
143.title: "The Only Thing More Boring than Mowing is Watching Someone Mowing!"
143.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie watches Hi push the lawnmower back and forth.

144.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
144.title: "Or Else Mr. Thurston Next Door is Cooking Outside Again"
144.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie sees the sky darkening, and thinks it might rain.

145.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
145.title: "Sorry, I Had a Slurp in My Ear"
145.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie didn't hear Lois call because Dawg was licking her.

146.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
146.title: "This Will Be Fun, I Promise!"
146.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi has promised Lois he'll watch Trixie, and Thirsty he'll play golf.

147.heading: Flagston, Trixie.
147.title: "What a Boring Life That Kid Has Staring at Me All Day"
147.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie wonders what the goldfish thinks.

148.heading: Flagwaving.
148.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
148.author: [No author]

149.title: Flagg, James Montgomery, 1877-1960
notes:
American
        cartoonist
